publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The Dorothy Peterson Collection contains Correspondence to Peterson from such persons as Langston Hughes, Nella Larsen, and Carl Van Vechten.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The Dorothy Peterson Collection contains items presented to the James Weldon Johnson Collection by Ms. Peterson and friends of hers.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Dorothy Peterson Collection is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Dorothy Peterson Collection. Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.
Correspondence with Rudolph Fisher and Jean Toomer is restricted. Please consult the appropriate curator for further information.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This finding aid was produced from a previously existing manuscripts inventory. All pertinent information has been retained.

bioghist.head: DOROTHY PETERSON
bioghist.p: Dorothy Peterson was a teacher of Spanish at Wadleigh High School in New York City. She was involved in the Harlem writers' scene with such organizations as the Negro Actors' Guild, continuing the commitment to African-American causes shown by her father, noted journalist Jerome Peterson.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Dorothy Peterson Collection contains Correspondence to Peterson from such persons as Langston Hughes, Nella Larsen, and Carl Van Vechten.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Biographical eulogy "Jerome B. Peterson: A Negro Friend"

p.ref: See: Negro Actors Guild, Box 2, folder 34

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes review of Knowlton Mixer's Porto Rico by Dorothy Peterson and letter to Carl Van Vechten from DP

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence with Harrison, Laurence (To: 1 / From: 1)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes: "A House in Taos," "Greetings for Canada Lee," "The Ballad of Dorrie Miller," "Here to Yonder: Noblesse Oblige" and"The Christmas Story" by LH

p.ref: See: Negro Actor's Guild, Box 2, folder 34

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes letter from Locke to Alexander Scholley Pace

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letters signed by Elmer A. Carter, J. Rosamond Johnson, Mabel A. Roane and Noble Sissle

p.ref: See: Negro Actors Guild, Box 2, folder 34

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Restricted fragile material. For further information consult the appropriate curator.
